quotes.quote: The years wrinkle our skin, but lack of enthusiasm wrinkles our soul.
Don't think of it as wrinkles. Think of ot as relaxed-fit skin.
Wrinkles are engraved smiles.
Wrinkles will only go where the smiles have been.
When grace is joined with wrinkles, it is adorable. There is an unspeakable dawn in happy old age.
If you don't have wrinkles, you haven't laughed enough.
With time we will all stop fighting pimples and start fighting wrinkles.
Injuries heal, but wrinkles are the scars of time.
The best people are the good old wrinkled people with a sparkle in their eye, a wink when you walk by or a toothless smile saying you are doing just fine.
If God had to give a woman wrinkles, He might at least have put them on the soles of her feet.
Wrinkles are hereditary. Parents get them from their children.
Age imprints more wrinkles in the mind than it does on the face.
Take care that old age does not wrinkle your spirit even more than your face.
Wrinkles are ditches that the gods have dug for our tears.
Wrinkles on the brow are the imprints of exploits.
Years wrinkle the skin. Giving up wrinkles the soul.
Wrinkles ought to be worn as a badge of honour, as a mark of survival if not wisdom.
That fair face will as years roll on lose its beauty, and old age will bring its wrinkles to the brow.
The latest wrinkle is on wrinkles. There is a widespread belief that women can't grow old in television news.
Wrinkles happen to human beings.
Hard work keeps the wrinkles out of the mind and spirit.
Your wrinkles either show that you're nasty, cranky, and senile, or that you're always smiling.
There is no wrinkle-free life.
Politeness smooths wrinkles.
Age does not bring you wisdom, age brings you wrinkles.

quotes.cite: Marie de Rabutin-Chantal, marquise de Sevigne
quotes.quote: The heart has no wrinkles.
There's always the new wrinkle. One must keep one's eyes always open.
